symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses: Gastrointestinal disorders (e.g., Crohns disease, ulcerative colitis)
Angioedema due to C1 inhibitor deficiency
Diabetes mellitus (especially with peripheral neuropathy, diabetic foot ulcers, and impaired immune function)
Amyloidosis (can cause neuropathy, skin changes like onychodystrophy, gastrointestinal issues like diarrhea, and organ dysfunction leading to ulcers)
Chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP, can cause sensory neuropathies, and sometimes ulcers due to decreased sensation)
Sarcoidosis (can cause neuropathy, skin lesions, gastrointestinal problems, and organ involvement)
Vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessels, can lead to neuropathy, ulcers, and multi-organ involvement)
HIV infection (can cause neuropathy, diarrhea, ulcers, and immune system abnormalities)
Lyme disease (can cause neuropathy, joint pain, and other systemic symptoms)
Vitamin B12 deficiency (can cause neuropathy and diarrhea)
Celiac disease (can cause neuropathy, malabsorption leading to diarrhea, and skin issues)
Paraneoplastic syndromes (immune responses to cancer, can cause neuropathy and various other symptoms)
